Adult.description: Black-footed Albatross is all dark, without the white head, belly, and rump of Laysan Albatross.
Adult Short-tailed Albatross has a larger, pink bill compared to Laysan Albatross's smaller, yellowish bill. Adult Short-tailed has yellow on the head and neck and a white, not brown, back.

Breeding adult.description: Western Gulls are more likely to be seen near the coast rather than in the open ocean like Albatrosses. They are smaller than Laysan Albatrosses with a gray, not brown, back, and a smaller, non-hooked bill.

Adult.description: Western Gulls are smaller with shorter wings than Laysan Albatrosses and a different flight style involving more flapping. Western Gulls have gray wings with black wingtips and all-white tails, unlike the brown back and dark tail of Laysan Albatross.
